```{r}
sugar_limitation <- function(s, l, g, epsilon = 1e-8) {
  out <- ifelse(s < l,
                0,
                pmin(1, (s - l) / (g + epsilon)))
  return(out)
}

sugar <- seq(0, 1, length.out = 100)

par(mfrow = c(1, 2))

# First plot
plot(sugar, sugar_limitation(sugar, 0.2, 0.5), type = "l",
     xlab = "Sugar", ylab = "Sugar Limitation (0-1)")
lines(sugar, sugar_limitation(sugar, 0.1, 0.5), col = "blue")
lines(sugar, sugar_limitation(sugar, 0.3, 0.5), col = "red")

legend("bottomright",
       legend = c("l = 0.2, g = 0.5",
                  "l = 0.1, g = 0.5",
                  "l = 0.3, g = 0.5"),
       col = c("black", "blue", "red"),
       lty = 1, cex = 0.8, bty = "n")

# Second plot
plot(sugar, sugar_limitation(sugar, 0.2, 0.25), type = "l",
     xlab = "Sugar", ylab = "Sugar Limitation (0-1)")
lines(sugar, sugar_limitation(sugar, 0.2, 0.5), col = "green")
```

```{r}
w_target <- function(T_air, PAR,
                     T_crit = 5, PAR_crit = 30,
                     kT = 2, kPAR = 10) {

  f_T   <- 1 / (1 + exp(-(T_air - T_crit) / kT))
  f_PAR <- 1 / (1 + exp(-(PAR - PAR_crit) / kPAR))

  1 - f_T * f_PAR
}

update_w <- function(w_prev, T_air, PAR, tau = 7) {
  w_star <- w_target(T_air, PAR)
  w_new  <- w_prev + (w_star - w_prev) / tau
  return(w_new)
}

w_star <- w_target(weather_2015$T, weather_2015$PAR)

w <- numeric(length(w_star))
w[1] <- w_star[1]  # initialise

for (i in 2:length(w_star)) {
  w[i] <- update_w(w[i - 1],
                   weather_2015$T[i],
                   weather_2015$PAR[i],
                   tau = 7)
}

plot(w_star,
     type = "l",
     col = "grey",
     lwd = 1,
     ylim = c(0, 1),
     xlab = "Day of year (2025)",
     ylab = "Winter scaling (w)",
     main = "Winter scaling with physiological delay (2025)")

lines(w,
      col = "blue",
      lwd = 2)

legend("bottomright",
       legend = c("Instantaneous response", "Delayed response (τ = 7 days)"),
       col = c("grey", "blue"),
       lwd = c(1, 2),
       bty = "n",
       cex = 0.75)
```

```{r}
# 1️⃣ Sugar availability (bottom limit)
sigma_s <- function(s, s_crit) {
  out <- s / s_crit
  out <- pmin(pmax(out, 0), 1)
  return(out)
}

# 2️⃣ Max storage capacity (top limit)
sigma_max <- function(c_st, s, theta_max) {
  out <- 1 - (c_st + s - (theta_max/2)) / (theta_max/2)  # 1 when empty, 0 when full
  out <- pmin(pmax(out, 0), 1)                           # clip to [0,1]
  return(out)
}
```

```{r}
F_function <- function(Ss, St, V, Theta, A0, delta, eps = 1e-6) {

  # Effective sugar above lower bound
  s <- pmax(0, Ss - V)

  # Sugar availability (1 if s > 0, else 0)
  K_s = 0.25 * Theta
  sigma_s <- s / (s + K_s)

  # Remaining shared storage capacity
  Theta_free <- pmax(0, Theta - (St))
  sigma_Theta <- Theta_free / (Theta_free + eps)

  # Fluxes
  F_syn <- A0 * sigma_s * sigma_Theta
  F_rem <- delta * St * (1 - sigma_s)

  # Net flux (positive: sugar -> starch)
  F <- F_syn - F_rem

  return(F)
}
```

```{r}
F_capacity <- function(S, r, W = 0.5, theta_max = 0.5, 
                       A0 = 0.2, delta = 0.2, k = 20) {
  
  # effective sugar after winter cost
  s <- S - W
  
  # --- Hard-limit logistic functions ---
  # Sugar availability (for synthesis)
  sigma_s <- function(s, k) 1 / (1 + exp(k * (0 - s)))
  
  # Starch max capacity (synthesis stops when r -> theta_max)
  sigma_r_max <- function(r, theta_max, k) 1 / (1 + exp(k * (r + s - theta_max)))
  
  # Starch minimum for remobilization
  sigma_r_min <- function(r, k) 1 / (1 + exp(k * (0 - r)))
  
  # --- Fluxes ---
  # Synthesis: sugar -> starch
  F_syn <- A0 * s * sigma_r_max(r, theta_max, k) # sigma_s(s, k) * 
  
  # Remobilization: starch -> sugar
  # Remove multiplication by sigma_s(s, k), or optionally multiply by (1 - sigma_s(s,k))
  F_rem <- delta * r * sigma_r_min(r, k)
  
  # --- Combine smoothly ---
  # alpha still interpolates between synthesis and remobilization
  alpha <- sigma_s(s, k)
  F <- alpha * F_syn - (1 - alpha) * F_rem
  
  return(F)
}

# --- Parameters ---
W <- 0.5
theta_max <- 1
A0 <- 1.2
delta <- 1.2
k <- 20

sugar <- seq(0, 1, length.out = 100)
starch <- seq(0, 1, length.out = 100)

par(mfrow = c(1, 2))

ylim = range(F_capacity(sugar, 0.25, W, theta_max, A0, delta, k), 
             F_capacity(sugar, 0.5, W, theta_max, A0, delta, k),
             F_capacity(sugar, 0.75, W, theta_max, A0, delta, k))
# --- Plot 1: Transfer to starch vs sugar ---

     xlab = "Sugar", ylab = "Transferred to Starch",
     type = "l", col = "yellow", ylim = ylim)
lines(sugar, F_capacity(sugar, 0.5, W, theta_max, A0, delta, k), col = "orange")
lines(sugar, F_capacity(sugar, 0.75, W, theta_max, A0, delta, k), col = "red")
abline(v = W, col = "black", lty = 2)  # reference line
abline(v = theta_max, col = "black", lty = 3)  # reference line

legend("topleft",
       legend = c("Starch = 0.25", "Starch = 0.5", "Starch = 0.75"),
```

```{r}
# Define the function f_m
f_m <- function(S_m, k_s) {
  return(S_m / (S_m + k_s))
}

# Range of S_m values
S_m_values <- seq(0, 1, by = 0.1)

# Different k_s values to plot
k_values <- c(0.01, 0.2, 0.5)

# Colors for each curve
colors <- c("blue", "red", "green")

# Create empty plot (without title)
plot(S_m_values, f_m(S_m_values, k_values[1]), type = "n",
     xlab = "Sugar Transfered to Mycorrhiza", ylab = "Percentage of Nitrogen Uptake Transfered",
     ylim = c(0, 1))  # y-axis goes from 0 to 1

# Add curves for each k_s
for(i in 1:length(k_values)) {
  lines(S_m_values, f_m(S_m_values, k_values[i]), col = colors[i], lwd = 2)
}

# Add a legend
legend("bottomright",
       legend = sapply(k_values, function(k) bquote(beta[m] == .(k))),
       col = colors, lwd = 2)
```

### Model states

```{r}

myco_seasonality_smooth <- function(TAir, temp_threshold = 5,
                                    window = 5,  # moving average window in days
                                    peak_length = 40,
                                    end_day = 220,
                                    slope = 0.075) {
  
  n_days <- length(TAir)
  days <- 1:n_days
  
  # --- Smooth temperature using moving average ---
  smooth_T <- stats::filter(TAir, rep(1/window, window), sides = 1)
  smooth_T[is.na(smooth_T)] <- TAir[is.na(smooth_T)]  # fallback for first days
  
  # --- Determine start day based on smoothed temperature ---
  start_day <- which(smooth_T >= temp_threshold)[1]
  if (is.na(start_day)) start_day <- n_days / 4  # fallback if threshold never reached
  
  # --- Spring ramp: smooth sigmoid from 0 to 1 ---
  spring <- 1 / (1 + exp(-slope * (days - start_day)))
  
  # --- Autumn taper: smooth sigmoid from 1 to 0 ---
  autumn <- 1 / (1 + exp(slope * (days - end_day)))
  
  # --- Combine ---
  myco_factor <- spring * autumn

  return(myco_factor)
}

# Example usage
myco_factor <- myco_seasonality_smooth(weather_2015$T)

plot(myco_factor, type="l",
     ylab="Mycorrhizal activity",
     xlab="Day of year",
     main="Smooth Temperature-Dependent Mycorrhizal Activity")

```
